Friends

class XMLHandle

Detailed Description

A specialisation of DataSection that deals with XML files.

Each XMLSection is tied to an XMLResource. By this, all instances of XMLSection are linked that way - change the values of one XML element and it will affect all the XMLSection instances linked to the XMLResource.

See also:
DataSection, XMLResource

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Constructor for XMLSection.

Parameters:

bool  cstrToken

Constructor for XMLSection when we don't want to copy the tag string.

Destructor for XMLSection.

All other objects have their own destructors.

Member Function Documentation

BinaryPtr XMLSection::asBinary (  )  [protected, virtual]

This method converts the whole XML section to a binary pointer.

This is called in order to save the data in this section.

Reimplemented from DataSection.

std::string XMLSection::asBlob ( const std::string &  defaultVal = ""  )  [protected, virtual]

This method reads in the value of the specified tag as a BLOB.

With all of the read methods, a default value can be specified if the operation fails. The operation can fail if the tag given does not match any tags in the section.

Parameters:
defaultVal The default value should an error occur.
Returns:
The string read in or the default value if the read failed.

Reimplemented from DataSection.

std::string XMLSection::asString ( const std::string &  defaultVal = "",
int  flags = DS_IncludeWhitespace 
) [protected, virtual]

This method reads in the value of the specified tag as a string.

With all of the read methods, a default value can be specified if the operation fails. The operation can fail if the tag given does not match any tags in the section.

Parameters:
defaultVal The default value should an error occur.
flags Any operational flags. These are bitwise ORed by the calling code. Flags accepted are: DS_TrimWhitespace and DS_IncludeWhitespace.
Returns:
The string read in or the default value if the read failed.

int XMLSection::bytes (  )  const [protected, virtual]

This method returns the approximate number of bytes allocated by this section.

Since the XMLSection owns its children, this should be recursive.

Returns:
Number of bytes allocated

Implements DataSection.

int XMLSection::countChildren (  )  [protected, virtual]

This method returns the number of sections under this one.

Returns:
Number of sections.

Implements DataSection.

XMLSectionPtr XMLSection::createFromBinary ( const std::string &  rootTag,
BinaryPtr  pBlock 
) [static]

This static method creates a tree of XMLSections from the input buffer.

NOTE: the data in pBlock will get modified. If you need to keep pBlock unmodified, you must pass in a deep copy of it instead.

Parameters:
rootTag The tag of the root section.
pBlock Binary block containing XML
Returns:
The root of the tree on success, NULL otherwise.

XMLSectionPtr XMLSection::createFromFile ( const char *  filename,
bool  returnEmptySection = true 
) [static]

This static method creates a tree of XMLSections from the input file.

Parameters:
filename The full path to the file to load.
returnEmptySection True if an empty section should be returned on failure.
Returns:
The root of the tree on success, NULL otherwise.

XMLSectionPtr XMLSection::createFromStream ( const std::string &  tag,
std::istream &  astream 
) [static]

This static method creates a tree of XMLSections from the input stream.

Parameters:
tag The name of the root section.
astream Stream containing the file to load.
Returns:
The root of the tree on success, NULL otherwise.

DataSectionPtr XMLSection::insertSection ( const std::string &  tag,
int  index 
) [protected, virtual]

This method creates a new section at the index specified.

It will create a new section regardless of whether a section under the same tag exists at the current section.

Parameters:
tag The name/path of the section to be added.
index The index at which to insert the new DataSection
Returns:
A pointer to the DataSection added if successful. NULL otherwise.

Reimplemented from DataSection.

void XMLSection::setParent ( DataSectionPtr  pParent  )  [virtual]

This method sets the parent of this section.

Take care that when this method is used, the parent does NOT keep a reference to to its children, or else a circular reference will result.

Parameters:
pParent The new parent of the section.

Reimplemented from DataSection.
